content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like "Burley," "Division," and "Secretary." The Secretary is required to convey acquired lands, easements, and rights-of-way to Burley without compensation, including various infrastructure and improvements related to the Division. The Secretary is required to convey acquired lands, easements, and rights-of-way to Burley without compensation, including infrastructure like transmission lines and facilities for water delivery from the Southside Canal at the Minidoka Dam to land in Burley. Administrative costs for the transfer will be shared by the United States and Burley. The Secretary will transfer water rights to Burley, including natural flow, waste, seepage, return flow, and groundwater rights for the benefit of the Burley Irrigation District, in accordance with Idaho state law and existing contracts or decrees. The Falls Canal Company v. Charles N. Foster, et al., also known as the "Foster decree," outlines the allocation of water rights for lands within the Minidoka and Burley Irrigation Districts. The transfer of water rights should not impact the operation of the Minidoka Project or other adjudicated rights. The Secretary will allocate storage space in various reservoirs to Burley as described. The Secretary will provide Burley with project reserved power from various Reclamation Power Plants as per existing contracts. Nothing in this Act will affect Minidoka Irrigation District's right to joint use of the Southside Canal. The United States will not be liable for damages related to the conveyed project facilities, except for negligence prior to conveyance. No impact on rights of others unless specified. The United States will not be liable for damages related to the conveyed project facilities, except for negligence prior to conveyance. The Secretary must complete the conveyance within 2 years of enactment, providing a report on the transfer status to relevant committees within eighteen months.
